018
019package org.tquadrat.foundation.util;
020
021import static org.apiguardian.api.API.Status.STABLE;
022import static org.tquadrat.foundation.lang.Objects.isNull;
023import static org.tquadrat.foundation.lang.Objects.nonNull;
024import static org.tquadrat.foundation.lang.Objects.requireNonNullArgument;
025import static org.tquadrat.foundation.util.StringUtils.format;
026
027import java.lang.reflect.Array;
028import java.util.Optional;
029import java.util.concurrent.locks.ReentrantReadWriteLock;
030import java.util.function.IntFunction;
031
032import org.apiguardian.api.API;
033import org.tquadrat.foundation.annotation.ClassVersion;
034import org.tquadrat.foundation.exception.ValidationException;
035import org.tquadrat.foundation.lang.AutoLock;
036
037/**
038 *  <p>{@summary A stand-alone implementation for stack, without the ballast
039 *  from the Collections framework.}</p>
040 *  <p>This implementation is not synchronised, but thread-safe.</p>
041 *
042 *  @extauthor Thomas Thrien - thomas.thrien@tquadrat.org
043 *  @version $Id: Stack.java 1052 2023-03-06 06:30:36Z tquadrat $
044 *  @since 0.0.5
045 *
046 *  @param  <T> The type for the stack entries.
047 *
048 *  @UMLGraph.link
049 *
050 *  @see    java.util.Stack
051 */
052@SuppressWarnings( "NewClassNamingConvention" )
053@ClassVersion( sourceVersion = "$Id: Stack.java 1052 2023-03-06 06:30:36Z tquadrat $" )
054@API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
055public final class Stack<T>
056{
057        /*---------------*\
058    ====** Inner Classes **====================================================
059        \*---------------*/
060    /**
061     *  The stack entries.
062     *
063     *  @note   This class cannot be changed to a {@code record} (instead of
064     *      being a {@code class}) because a {@code record} as an inner class
065     *      is implicitly static, and that collides with the type argument
066     *      {@code <T>} that is inherited from the surrounding class.
067     *
068     *  @extauthor Thomas Thrien - thomas.thrien@tquadrat.org
069     *  @version $Id: Stack.java 1052 2023-03-06 06:30:36Z tquadrat $
070     *  @since 0.0.5
071     *
072     *  @UMLGraph.link
073     */
074    @ClassVersion( sourceVersion = "$Id: Stack.java 1052 2023-03-06 06:30:36Z tquadrat $" )
075    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
076    private final class Entry
077    {
078            /*------------*\
079        ====** Attributes **===================================================
080            \*------------*/
081        /**
082         *  The current head element.
083         */
084        private final T m_Head;
085
086        /**
087         *  The remaining elements.
088         */
089        @SuppressWarnings( "UseOfConcreteClass" )
090        private final Entry m_Tail;
091
092            /*--------------*\
093        ====** Constructors **=================================================
094            \*--------------*/
095        /**
096         *  Creates a new {@code Stack} object.
097         *
098         *  @param  head    The current head.
099         *  @param  tail    The current tail; may be {@code null}, indicating
100         *      an empty tail.
101         */
102        @SuppressWarnings( "UseOfConcreteClass" )
103        public Entry( final T head, final Entry tail )
104        {
105            m_Head = head;
106            m_Tail = tail;
107        }   //  Entry()
108
109            /*---------*\
110        ====** Methods **======================================================
111            \*---------*/
112        /**
113         *  Returns the current head.
114         *
115         *  @return The head.
116         */
117        public final T head() { return m_Head; }
118
119        /**
120         *  Returns the current tail.
121         *
122         *  @return The tail.
123         */
124        @SuppressWarnings( "ReturnOfInnerClass" )
125        public final Entry tail() { return m_Tail; }
126    }
127    //  class Entry
128
129        /*-----------*\
130    ====** Constants **========================================================
131        \*-----------*/
132    /**
133     *  An empty array of {@code Stack} objects.
134     */
135    @SuppressWarnings( "rawtypes" )
136    public static final Stack [] EMPTY_Stack_ARRAY = new Stack [0];
137
138        /*------------*\
139    ====** Attributes **=======================================================
140        \*------------*/
141    /**
142     *  The number of entries on the stack.
143     */
144    private int m_Count = 0;
145
146    /**
147     *  The entries.
148     */
149    @SuppressWarnings( "UseOfConcreteClass" )
150    private Entry m_Entries = null;
151
152    /**
153     *  The &quot;read&quot; lock.
154     */
155    private final AutoLock m_ReadLock;
156
157    /**
158     *  The &quot;write&quot; lock.
159     */
160    private final AutoLock m_WriteLock;
161
162        /*--------------*\
163    ====** Constructors **=====================================================
164        \*--------------*/
165    /**
166     *  Creates a new {@code Stack} object.
167     */
168    public Stack()
169    {
170        final var lock = new ReentrantReadWriteLock( false );
171        m_ReadLock = AutoLock.of( lock.readLock() );
172        m_WriteLock = AutoLock.of( lock.writeLock() );
173    }   //  Stack()
174
175        /*---------*\
176    ====** Methods **==========================================================
177        \*---------*/
178    /**
179     *  Empties the whole stack in one go.
180     */
181    public final void clear()
182    {
183        m_WriteLock.execute( () ->
184        {
185            m_Entries = null;
186            m_Count = 0;
187        } );
188    }   //  clear()
189
190    /**
191     *  <p>{@summary Tests if the stack is not empty.}</p>
192     *  <p>If concurrent threads will access the stack, it is still possible
193     *  that this method will return {@code true}, but a call to
194     *  {@link #pop()}
195     *  immediately after returns {@code null}.</p>
196     *
197     *  @return {@code true} if there are still entries on the stack,
198     *      {@code false} otherwise.
199     *
200     *  @see #isEmpty()
201     */
202    public final boolean hasMore() { return !isEmpty(); }
203
204    /**
205     *  <p>{@summary Tests if the stack is empty.}</p>
206     *  <p>If concurrent threads will access the stack, it is still possible
207     *  that this method will return {@code false}, but a call to
208     *  {@link #pop()}
209     *  immediately after returns {@code null}.</p>
210     *
211     *  @return {@code true} if there are no entries on the stack,
212     *      {@code false} otherwise.
213     *
214     *  @see #hasMore()
215     */
216    public final boolean isEmpty()
217    {
218        var retValue = false;
219        try( final var ignore = m_ReadLock.lock() )
220        {
221            retValue = isNull( m_Entries );
222        }
223
224        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
225        return retValue;
226    }   //  isEmpty()
227
228    /**
229     *  <p>{@summary Returns the first entry from the stack <i>without</i>
230     *  removing it from the stack.}</p>
231     *  <p>If concurrent threads will access the stack, it is still possible
232     *  that this method will return a different value than a consecutive call
233     *  to
234     *  {@link #pop()}.</p>
235     *
236     *  @return An instance of
237     *      {@link Optional}
238     *      that holds the first entry; it will be empty if the stack is empty.
239     */
240    public final Optional<T> peek()
241    {
242        final var retValue = m_ReadLock.execute( () -> nonNull( m_Entries ) ? m_Entries.head() : null );
243
244        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
245        return retValue;
246    }   //  peek()
247
248    /**
249     *  Returns the first entry from the stack and removes it.
250     *
251     *  @return An instance of
252     *      {@link Optional}
253     *      that holds the first entry; it will be empty if the stack is empty.
254     */
255    public final Optional<T> pop()
256    {
257        Optional<T> retValue = Optional.empty();
258        try( final var ignore = m_WriteLock.lock() )
259        {
260            if( nonNull( m_Entries ) )
261            {
262                retValue = Optional.of( m_Entries.head() );
263                m_Entries = m_Entries.tail();
264                --m_Count;
265            }
266        }
267
268        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
269        return retValue;
270    }   //  pop()
271
272    /**
273     *  Add the given entry to the stack.
274     *
275     *  @param  entry   The value to add.
276     */
277    public final void push( final T entry )
278    {
279        requireNonNullArgument( entry, "entry" );
280        m_WriteLock.execute( () ->
281        {
282            m_Entries = new Entry( entry, m_Entries );
283            ++m_Count;
284        } );
285    }   //  push()
286
287    /**
288     *  <p>{@summary Adds the given entries to the stack, in LIFO order.}
289     *  Nothing happens, if the provided array is empty.</p>
290     *  <p>The provided array may not contain {@code null} elements.</p>
291     *  <p>If the push failed for anyone element of the array, the stack
292     *  remained unchanged.</p>
293     *  <p>The method guarantees that the elements of the array are stored to
294     *  the stack in consecutive order, even in a multithreaded
295     *  environment.</p>
296     *
297     *  @param  entries   The values to add.
298     *  @throws IllegalArgumentException    At least one element of the
299     *      provided array is {@code null}.
300     */
301    @SafeVarargs
302    public final void push( final T... entries ) throws IllegalArgumentException
303    {
304        for( var i = 0; i < requireNonNullArgument( entries, "entries" ).length; ++i )
305        {
306            if( isNull( entries [i] ) ) throw new ValidationException( format( "The entry %1$d of the arguments list is null", i ) );
307        }
308
309        m_WriteLock.execute( () ->
310        {
311            for( final var entry : entries )
312            {
313                m_Entries = new Entry( entry, m_Entries );
314                ++m_Count;
315            }
316        } );
317    }   //  push()
318
319    /**
320     *  Returns the number of entries on the stack.
321     *
322     *  @return The number of entries.
323     */
324    public final int size() { return m_Count; }
325
326    /**
327     *  <p>{@summary Returns all entries that are currently on the stack as an
328     *  array without removing them, with the top most entry as the first.}
329     *  Therefore, this is more or less a
330     *  {@link #peek()}
331     *  on the whole stack.</p>
332     *  <p>If the provided array is larger that the number of elements on the
333     *  stack, the exceeding entries on that array remained unchanged.</p>
334     *
335     *  @param  target  The target array; if this array has an insufficient
336     *      size, a new array will be created.
337     *  @return An array with all entries on the stack; never {@code null}. If
338     *      the provided array was large enough to take all elements, it will
339     *      be returned, otherwise the returned array is a new one and the
340     *      provided array is unchanged.
341     */
342    @SuppressWarnings( {"unchecked", "MethodCanBeVariableArityMethod"} )
343    public final T [] toArray( final T [] target )
344    {
345        requireNonNullArgument( target, "target" );
346
347        @SuppressWarnings( {"OptionalGetWithoutIsPresent", "OverlyLongLambda"} )
348        final var retValue = m_ReadLock.execute( () ->
349            {
350                final var result = target.length >= m_Count ? target : (T []) Array.newInstance( target.getClass().getComponentType(), m_Count );
351                var index = 0;
352                var entries = m_Entries;
353                while( nonNull( entries ) )
354                {
355                    result [index++] = entries.head();
356                    entries = entries.tail();
357                }
358                return result;
359            } ).get();
360
361        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
362        return retValue;
363    }   //  toArray()
364
365    /**
366     *  <p>{@summary Returns all entries that are currently on the stack as an
367     *  array without removing them, with the top most entry as the first.}
368     *  Therefore, this is more or less a
369     *  {@link #peek()}
370     *  on the whole stack.</p>
371     *
372     *  @param  supplier    The supplier for the target array.
373     *  @return An array with all entries on the stack; never {@code null}.
374     */
375    public final T [] toArray( final IntFunction<T []> supplier )
376    {
377        @SuppressWarnings( "OptionalGetWithoutIsPresent" )
378        final var retValue = m_ReadLock.execute( () -> toArray( requireNonNullArgument( supplier, "supplier" ).apply( m_Count ) ) )
379            .get();
380
381        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
382        return retValue;
383    }   //  toArray()
384}
385//  class Stack
386
387/*
388 *  End of File
389 */
